title: James Corden is bringing The Late Late show to Australia in 2021
text:
James Corden is set to bring his popular program, The Late Late Show, to Australia for a tour in 2021.

According to The Sunday Telegraph, the talk show host will be coming Down Under to film a number of episodes.

He will also reportedly invite Australian A-list celebrities such as Chris Hemsworth or Margot Robbie, to take part in his famous Carpool Karaoke segment.

He's coming! James Corden (pictured) is set to bring his popular program, The Late Late Show, to Australia for a tour in 2021

In a statement, Network Ten's chief content officer, Beverley McGarvey said: 'We are hoping James and his team will make it to Australia in 2021 to film some shows. We will have more information on that next year.'

Network Ten has been airing James' show after it was acquired by CBS in 2017 - the broadcaster behind the show in the US.

But this won't be James' first trip to Australia, as he most recently paid a fleeting visit to Sydney in September.

Exciting: James will reportedly film a number of episodes and his Carpool Karaoke segment in Australia. Pictured with Kylie Minogue and Benedict Cumberbatch

His trip sparked speculation that he could be starring on The Masked Singer after he came to film a 'secret project.'

The Daily Telegraph reported that it would not be surprising if he had flown into the country to film the show for Channel Ten.

He is also no stranger to showcasing his vocal talents and has sung alongside many stars in his Carpool Karaoke segment.

Is he behind the mask? In September, James (pictured) paid a fleeting visit to Sydney which sparked speculation he could be on The Masked Singer Australia

Meanwhile, The Late Late Show with James Corden has proved to be a huge success and attracts an average of 1.2 million viewers daily.

The show has even won 13 Emmy Awards including Variety Special and his Carpool Karaoke segment won Short Form Variety Series.

James has been hosting the show since 2015.
description: James Corden is set to bring his popular program, The Late Late Show, to Australia for a tour in 2021.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
